intro: Daphnopsis macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited daphnopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and dense, leathery foliage. The plant produces showy, spherical flower heads that are typically pink or red in color. Its fruit is a follicle containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Daphnopsis macrocarpa is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
